direction.raw_text: . TEXAS SCRUB -- DAY Two men in shorts and Hawaiian shirts are poking around a sandy section in the middle of scrub flats. SERGEANT CLIFF POTTS is in the f.g., a plant-and-tree guidebook in hand, as SERGEANT "MIKEY" HOGAN works a metal detector over a large, sandy bank in the b.g.  Both are Army career men with a morning off to pursue their hobbies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got ocotillo, devil's walking stick--what's this stuff--it's that whattayoucallit--horse-crippler. Mikey bends to scoop something out of the sand, putting it in a canvas bag slung on his hip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This place is a gold mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lead mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees that Cliff is talking, pulls his headset off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a lead mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know why I'm talking to you, you've got that thing on your head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You finding lots of cactus and shit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not just cactus.  There's the nopals, the yuccas--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like a lot of cactus to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man knows a hundred-fifty varieties of beer, he can't tell a poinsettia from a prickly pear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cliff--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You live in a place, you should know something about it. Explore--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cliff--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the f.g. now, looking down at something as he pulls his headset off again--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cliff, you gotta look at this-- Cliff wearily turns and approaches from the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell me--Spanish treasure, right?  Pieces of eight from the Coronado expedition-- He stops by Mikey and looks down, his expression changing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sticking out from the sand bank are the SKELETAL BONES of a MAN'S HAND.  There is a ring on one finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was Coronado in the Masons?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROAD -- DAY A distant cloud of DUST appears on the horizon MUSIC underscores that we are in Texas, and we SUPERIMPOSE the OPENING CREDITS as the dust takes form around an APPROACHING CAR.  The car comes close enough to see it has a County Sheriff's insignia on the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see SAM DEEDS, the Sheriff, driving. Sam is 40, quietly competent to the point of seeming a bit moody. He sees something up ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Sam pulls off the road and we see the sergeants standing in the scrub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hand and forearm down to the elbow of the skeleton are visible now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R Cliff stands looking at the arm with Sam. MIKEY is a few yards behind them, playing with his metal detector. Beyond him we see the Sheriff's car parked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was driving back from Apache Wells when they got me on the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was a rifle range way back when. But we figured it isn't Army land anymore, it's your jurisdiction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got the forensics fella coming down from the Rangers. No way to know how old the body is without some lab work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That ring--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Masons been around a long while. Mikey has come up to them, still sweeping with the metal detector.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Treasure hunter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old bullets.  He uhm-- makes art with them. Sam just nods. Mikey frowns, goes down on one knee and scratches something out of the dirt at their feet--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Sheriff says we shouldn't touch anything,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't hear with that rig on-- Mikey! Mikey comes up with something, holds it before them. An encrusted piece of metal--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What've we got here? Sam takes the thing, lays it back down where Mikey found it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S'posed to leave everything right where we found it. They're real particular about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The scene of the crime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No telling yet if there's been a crime. Sam frowns down at the piece of metal as he rubs the face of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam's thumb wipes across the face of the encrusted metal. It is roughly star-shaped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But this country's seen a good number of disagreements over the years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We look at a beautiful old pull-down map of Texas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We do the best we can here-- A teacher in her late 30s, PILAR CRUZ, steps in front of the map and we FOLLOW her across the room, carrying a poster
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --but hey, public education these days is a bit of a battleground. Posters hung on the walls beyond her show luminaries from Texas history-- Sam Houston, Stephen Austin, Juan Seguin. A new parent, CELIE PAYNE, stands in the middle of the otherwise empty classroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He went to school on base when we were in Okinawa. It's all--you know-- kids in the same boat--Army brats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His record shows that he's a good student.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm more worried about the social thing. Are therelike--gangs, or...?
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: HIGH SCHOOL CLASSROOM -- DAY -- TEXAS MAP

direction.raw_text: starts to put the poster up. CELIE moves to hold it in place for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We haven't had any serious violence, if that's what you mean. We've got a pretty lively mix though--you walk into the cafeteria and the Anglo kids are in one section, the Mexican kids in another and the Black kids have a table in the back--thanks--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Blacks are--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're the smallest group except for a couple Kickapoo kids. Look, you're obviously a concerned parent. Chet has no history of getting into trouble--I'm happy to have him in my class. She steps back to see if the poster, an old photo of Geronimo, looks straight. Another teacher, MOLLY sticks her head in the door--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pilar, is uhm--is Amado okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay? He's not here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Is he sick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's going to wish he was dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the door of a deluxe pickup truck is an airbrushed picture of a Pancho Villa-looking vaquero with bandoliers crossing his chest and a gun blazing in each hand. We hear LOUD MUSIC-- AMADO (O.S.) Luis! Give me that Phillips-head back--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R A small group of teenage Chicano BOYS hang around the truck in the bed, on the hood, leaning against it. A BOOMBOX placed on top of the cab blasts RANCHA MUSIC out at the neighborhood. Somebody's legs are hanging out the open passenger-side door. The kids suddenly look as a Sheriff's Department car slides into the f.g.  A Deputy Sheriff, TRAVIS, gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trying to look tough and unworried as we TRACK across the street toward them. Travis's hand reaches out from behind the camera to flick the MUSIC OFF.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pilar's 15-year-old son, lies on the front seat installing a compact disc player into the dash slot. He reaches up to the dash, can't find what he wants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody hand me the CD player-- damelo pendejos-- He looks up and we TILT to see Travis leaning in the window, examining the new radio
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They come a long way from those old 8-track jobs, haven't they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is stolen property. Alla you fellas are coming down to the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweat beads the forehead of a thin, tired-looking recent immigrant, ENRIQUE, as he delivers platters of chile rellenos to a booth. MEXICAN MUSIC plays on a jukebox in the b.g. We HOLD on the booth, where HOLLIS POGUE, in his 60s entertains two GOOD OLD BOYS-- HOLLIS So Buddy walks up to the porch and there's old Fishbait McHenry, cleanin' the dirt out his toenails with a pocketknife--he was the most hygienic of all the McHenrys-- The breakfast companions are laughing already--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Fishbait," says Buddy, in that quiet way of his, "What you know about them tires that went missing from markets?" Fishbait thinks for a minute, then he lifts up a loose board from the porch floor and calls down into it, "C'mon out, Pooter, they caught us!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy Deeds. He had a way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He known who it was onnacouna the tire tracks in the dirt from the back of the garage to where they loaded up. "Old Fishbait," he says, "never lifted a thing in this world if there was a way he could roll it." More laughter--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Won't be another like him. That boy of his doesn't come near it. You ask me, he's all hat and no cattle
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fellas-- We WIDEN to see Sam standing by their booth. No telling how long he's been listening, Fenton is embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam! I was just telling a few about your old man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was a unique individual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he was that. We sense a little strain when Sam has to talk about his father--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big day coming up--I wish we'd have thought of it while he was still living. But he went so unexpected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better late than never. Korean War hero, Sheriff for near thirty years-- Buddy Deeds Memorial P-- SAM I heard there was a bit of a fuss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you know, the usual troublemakers. Danny Padilla from the Sentinel, that crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every other damn thing in the country is called after Martin Luther King, they can't let our side have one measly park?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: King wasn't Mexican, Fenton--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bad enough all the street names are in Spanish--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were here first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then name it after Big Chief Shitinabucket! Whoever that Tonkawa fella was. He had the Mexes beat by centuries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a faction pulling for that boy who was killed in the Gulf War-- Ruben--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Santiago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. But nobody here ever noticed him till they read his name on the national news--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They just wanted it to be one of theirs--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not the whole story. The Mexicans that know, that remember, understand what Buddy was for their people.  Hell, it was Mercedes over there who swung the deciding vote for him. Sam looks to the register where Pilar's mother, MERCEDES CRUZ, whacks rolls of change apart on the counter. She seems to be avoiding looking toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She put it even at three to three, so as the Mayor I get to cast the tiebreaker. The older generation won't have any problem with it. They remember how Buddy come to be Sheriff, that it was all 'cause he took their part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell that one, Hollis--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, everybody heard that story a million times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to hear it. Your version of it. Something about the way Sam says it puts Hollis on guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead, Hollis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hollis is hooked into it now--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two of us were the only deputies back then me and Buddy--it's what--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 1 believe--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the Sheriff at the time was Big Charley Wade. Charley was one of your old-fashioned bribe-or-bullets kind of Sheriffs, he took a healthy bite out of whatever moved through this county. He looks down at the table--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was in here one night, back  when Jimmy Herrera run the place.   Started right here in this booth. We PAN down to the table, The food has changed. The tortillas are in a straw basket instead of plastic. The jukebox changes to ANOTHER SONG and the LIGHT DIMS slightly. A hand with a big Masonic ring on one finger appears to lift a tortilla-- underneath it lie three ten-dollar bills.  The hand lifts them up and we TILT to see the face of SHERIFF CHARLEY WADE, a big, mean redneck with shrewd eyes. It is 1957-- WADE (Grins) This beaner fare doesn't agree with me, but the price sure is right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R Wade sits across from his young deputies, YOUNG HOLLIS (30s) and BUDDY DEEDS (20s). A chicken-fried steak sits untouched in front of Buddy. Hollis has the anxious look of an errand boy, while Buddy is self-contained and quietly forceful for his age.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jimmy got a kitchen full of wetbacks, most of 'em relatives. People breed like chickens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I roust some muchacho on the street, doesn't have his papers, all he got to say is "Yo trabajo para Jimmy Herrera." Wade folds the money and stuffs if in his pocket--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got to keep the wheels greased, son. Sheriff does his job right, everybody makes out. Now this is gonna be one of your pickups, Buddy. First of the month, just like the rent. Get the car, Hollis. Wade and Hollis slide out of the booth to stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not doing it. Hollis stops a few feet away, shocked. Wade just stares down at Buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come again? Buddy looks Wade in the eye, seemingly unafraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your deal. You sweated it out of him, you pick it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's gonna be some left over for you, Buddy. I take care of my boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not the point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You feeling bad for Jimmy? Have him tell you the size of the mordida they took out of his hide when he run a place on the other side. Those old boys in Ciudad Leon--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not picking it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do whatever I say you do or else you put it on the trail, son. The CUSTOMERS are all watching now, nervous. Buddy thinks for a moment, not taking his eyes off Wade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout this--how 'bout you put that shield on this table and  vanish before you end up dead or in jail? Wade rests his hand on his pistol.  It is dead silent but for the MUSIC on the box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ever shoot anybody was looking you in the eye?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who said anything about shootin' anybody? Buddy has his gun out under the table.  He slowly brings it up and lays it flat on the table, not taking his hand off it or his eyes off Wade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whole different story; isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're fired. You're outta the department.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's not a soul in this county isn't sick to death of your bullshit, Charley. You made yourself scarce, you could make a lot of people happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You little pissant--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now or later, Charley. You won't have any trouble finding me. Wade feels the people around him waiting for a reaction.  He leans close to Buddy to croak in a hoarse whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a dead man. He turns and nearly bumps into Hollis. He gives the Deputy a shove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the goddamn car. We're going to Roderick's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He watches till the screen door shuts behind them, then holsters his gun and begins to saw at the steak as if nothing had happened. He calls softly--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muchacho--mas cerveza por favor. He looks up at somebody and we PAN till we see Sam, still standing over the booth, listening. We are back in 1995-- HOLLIS (O.S.) "Mas cerveza por favor."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That Buddy was a cool breeze. We PULL BACK to see Hollis and his buddies at the table, eating their lunches as they listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charley Wade were known to have put a good number of people in the ground, and your daddy gets eyeball to eyeball with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We made our collection at Roderick's place and that was the last anybody seen hide nor hair of him.  He went missing the next day, along with ten thousand dollars in county funds from the safe at the jail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never heard from him again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a peep. Buddy run the man out of town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy Deeds said a thing, he damn well backed it up. Won't be another like him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he arrested all of Jimmy Herrera's people and sent 'em back to the other side? Hollis sees what Sam is getting at, grins--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh--he come to an accommodation. Money doesn't always need to change hands to keep the wheels turning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I know you had some problems with your father, and he and Muriel-- well--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother was a saint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --but Buddy Deeds was my salvation. Sam nods, speaks softly--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Won't be another like him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , a very direct, by-the-book Black officer, addresses them. Artillery pieces angle toward the sky behind him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --it's an honor for me to assume command of this unit, and I look forward to working with all of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cliff and Mikey, in uniform now, flank SERGEANT PRISCILLA WORTH, a Black woman in her early 40s, as they stand in formation--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure you're all aware of the Army's decision to close this installation under the Reduction in Force plan. That does not mean, however--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We look over the shoulders of assembled OFFICERS and NCOs toward Del.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --that we've been sent here to mark time until we are absorbed by another unit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may have heard rumors that I run a very tight operation. These rumors are not exaggerated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are looking through a magnifying glass at an old photo. Buddy's face is slightly distorted by the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam? I got Danny Padilla from the paper for you-- Sam sits at his desk in the Sheriff's office, looking down at the photo--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him I'll catch him later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An old photo of the 1957 Sheriff's Department officers on the courthouse steps. Wade, Hollis, Buddy, a few others, all in uniform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says he needs to talk to you before the ceremony, Sam. Sam puts a magnifying glass over the photo and bends close to look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him to try me tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the badge on Wade's chest swims into view. A metal star. We hear the secretary getting rid of the caller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He thinks you're trying to duck him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking at the photo, troubled--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We start on a BLINKING SIGN--BIG O'S, then PAN to see a full parking lot outside the low, neon-lit roadhouse. R&B MUSIC blasts from inside.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: BIG O'S ROADHOUSE -- NIGHT -- NEON SIGN

direction.raw_text: a Black kid around 15, stands nervously at the door building up his courage.  He takes a deep breath, plunges in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We TRACK with Chet, very nervous, as he makes his way through the crowded roadhouse. The customers are all Black, many from the nearby Army post, SHOUTING and LAUGHING over the loud MUSIC. Chet, edgy, is looking for somebody.  He sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- OTIS Seen through the crush is OTIS "BIG O" PAYNE, a large man in his early 60s, laughing as he stands behind the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He nervously puts his hand under his jacket. A gun? He pushes forward to get a better view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- OTIS Moving in on him. Otis looks over, sees the boy, frowns--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reaching under his jacket, he pulls out--a photograph. He looks at it--suddenly there is a SCREAM from behind, then GUNSHOTS, patrons diving for the floor. Chet whirls around and we WHIP PAN to see a young man, SHADOW, emptying his pistol into RICHIE, a young soldier, as a young woman, ATHENA, screams and tries to pull the gun away. With the last shot, Shadow turns and heads for the door, but is tackled and swarmed by angry men, SHOUTING. We PAN to Athena, kneeling over the bleeding, twitching body of Richie--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chet backs up, horrified. A large hand grasps him on the shoulder from behind. He turns to see Otis standing over him, strangely calm amid the chaos
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You weren't in here tonight, were you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go out through the back. Chet hurries away.  Otis watches him for a moment, then turns to the mess in his club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An angry woman stands from her auditorium chair--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just tearin' everything  down! Tearin' down our heritage, tearin' down the memory of people that fought and died for this land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We fought and died for this land, too! We WHIP PAN to see another standing parent--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We fought the U.S. Army, the Texas Rangers--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but you lost, buddy! We WHIP PAN to a man in the rear--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winners get the bragging rights, that's how it goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People--people--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R We are in the High School auditorium, a hot-and-heavy teachers- and-parents meeting in progress. Pilar sits at the end of a long table facing the agitated parents, taking some heat. DANNY PADILLA, a young, long-haired reporter, sits in the front taking notes, enjoying the show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it would be best not to put things in terms of winners and losers--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, the way she's teachin' it has got everything switched around. I was on the textbook committee, and her version is not--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We think of the textbook as kind of a guide, not an absolute--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --it is not what we set as the standard! Now you people can believe what you want, but when it comes to teaching our children--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're our children, too!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men who founded this state have a right to have their story--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men who founded this state broke from Mexico because they needed slavery to be legal to make a fortune in the cotton business!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that's a bit of an oversimplification--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you reporting this meeting or runnin' it, Danny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just adding a little historical perspective--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pilar's teenage daughter, peeks into the room, then moves down the side toward the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may call it history, but I call it propaganda. I'm sure they got their own account of the Alamo on the other side, but we're not on the other side, so we're not about to have it taught in our schools!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no reason to be so threatened by this-- Pilar is trying to stay calm despite her anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've only been trying to get across some of the complexity of our situation down here--cultures coming together in both negative and positive ways.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you mean like music and food and all, I have no problem with that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We shoot past Pilar toward the parents in their seats. PALOMA steps up to whisper to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --but when you start changing who did what to who.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not changing anything, we're presenting a more complete picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's what's got to stop! Pilar looks troubled by what she's heard. She shoots a look toward the others at the table, then slips away with Paloma--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's enough ignorance in the world without us encouraging it in the classroom--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now who are you calling ignorant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Folks, I know this is a very emotional issue for some of you, but we do have other business to attend to--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not going to get some resolution on this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weary--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you people like to form another committee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from the parents--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shadow, face bruised, hands cuffed behind him, is pushed in through the door to be booked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope the sucker does die, man! Mess with me, that's what you get! Sam steps in behind him and meets his Chief Deputy RAY HERNANDEZ, coming from the other direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hospital says the other kid is in bad shape--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shooter local?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that was the last time you saw him? We SHIFT to see Sam sitting where Wade was headed--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh--I think he came in one more time with Hollis and--naw, your Daddy wasn't with them. Made their monthly pickup. Roderick wasn't in so I just kept my mouth good and shut and handed over that envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was the night he disappeared?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could of been. That was white people's business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And when my father was Sheriff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was your deal with him? Otis smiles, chooses his words carefully--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy was more a part of the big picture--county political machine, chamber of commerce, zoning board if I kept those people happy, he was pretty much on my side. (Smiles) Whenever somebody thought--they start up another bar for the black  folks, they'd be--how should I put this? They'd be officially discouraged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ever accept cash for a favor? Otis smiles, looks away to ponder his response--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't recall a prisoner ever died in your father's custody. I don't recall a man in this town--Black, White, Mexican--who'd hesitate a minute before they'd call on Buddy Deeds to solve a problem. More than that I wouldn't like to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAR -- LATE AFTERNOON Pilar drives Amado and her daughter Paloma home--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you had your way I wouldn't have any friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, come on, Amado--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just 'cause I'm not like Little Miss Honor Roll here--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave your sister out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and all of the teachers in this dump--your story's over, so you don't want anybody else to have fun. We see on PILAR's face that he has scored--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You jerk--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not talking to you. You don't have any friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eases the car down San Jacinto street, seeing something on the street and she's tuning her kids' conversation out--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who'd want to be friends with that bunch of pachuco wannabes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't pretend I came over on the Mayflower--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And those stupid girls who hang out with them--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just shut up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- SAM Sam walks on the sidewalk parallel to them, talking with three other MEN-- PALOMA (O.S.) Joanie Orozco's telling the whole school she's like desperately in love with Santo Guerra.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's pathetic. You can't be desperately in love when you're 14 years old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pilar is still looking fixedly out the window--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if you have half a brain in your head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't have anything to do with being smart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SAN JACINTO STREET -- LATE AFTERNOON Danny Padilla is arguing with H.L. BRIGGS, a construction company big shot, and JORGE GUERRA, a Council member in his 40s and Sam, as they walk down the sidewalk of the main street--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I'm saying is, I don't see the point. You had your chance when the dedication committee was meeting--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got new information-- H.L. It's ancient goddarn history, Danny--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: they dam up the north branch to make Lake Pescadero. A whole little town disappears-- H.L. Squatter town--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People had been living in Perdido for over a hundred years. Mexicans and Chicanos are deported, evicted, moved forcibly out of their houses by our local hero, Buddy Deeds, and his department--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a bill from the state legislature--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Families were split apart, a whole community was destroyed-- H.L. They were trespassing, Danny--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --and who ends up with lakefront property bought for a fraction of the market price? Buddy Deeds, Sheriff of Rio County, and his Chief Deputy, Hollis Pogue. They all look at Sam, who has been listening patiently the whole while.  They've reached his office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You finished?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I'm not after you, Sam.  I just think people in town ought to know the full story on Buddy Deeds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That makes two of us. Sam steps into his office, leaving H.L. shaking his head-- H.L. You best be thankful that's the son and not the father. Buddy woulda kicked your ass from here to sundown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HALLWAY -- DEL'S HOUSE -- LATE AFTERNOON We TRACK down a hallway as Celie walks toward us, calling ahead. Chet stands in the middle of the hall behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see what the big deal is. Go back over, talk to the man, and bury the hatchet, Del--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: passes us and Del crosses back in the other direction from behind the camera, carrying boxes of their belongings. We continue our SLOW TRACK forward--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otis Payne was never embarrassed about a thing in his life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were 8 years old when he left--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't leave, he moved three houses down with one of my mother's best friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad--?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Hey, Delmore, where's your Daddy?" Del disappears into the bedroom at the end of the hall--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody else's business. And everybody loved Big O-- DEL comes back out, empty-handed--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big O was always there with a  smile or a loan or a free drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad, can I talk to you about track?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not that much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad, I talked to the track coach--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought we already had this out? Next year, if your grades are high enough--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a B average.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many B-average students do you think they take at West Point?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to have to see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we don't. Del steps away past us, leaving Chet, defeated--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We start on Enrique, talking surreptitiously on the pay phone on the way to the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sabado por la noche--Is, es el  mas seguero--a cruzar por la  manana y pues tendremos que esperar--[Friday night--Yes, that's the safest--I'll cross in the morning and then we'll have to wait--] Mercedes bustles by, snapping her fingers--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off the phone, by we've got people waiting. Andale! We FOLLOW Mercedes back into the kitchen, where she moves through, kibbitzing the operation--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mercedes stops by a young girl prepping a pork loin to be cooked. She isn't wearing gloves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donde estan sus guantes? Tonta! Quiere matar a mis clientes? [Where are your gloves? Stupid! You want to kill my customers?] She continues past, shaking her bead, bringing us to Pilar, who is trying to stay out of the way--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These ones coming up are getting stupider every year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you're just getting less patient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If they're going to survive here, they have to know how to work, Elalco! Adelante! Los clientes esperan!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you hire illegals--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody is illegal in my cafe! They've got green cards, they've got relatives who were born here--if they only had a little common sense I'd be very happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you spent a little more time training them--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you come here to tell me how to run my business?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I was wondering if you'd like to take a trip down south with us. Maybe see where you grew up--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would I want to go there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, come on--you must be curious how it's changed. Amado is into this big Tejano roots thing and I've never been further than Ciudad Leon--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to see Mexicans, open your eyes and look around you. We're up to our ears in them. Pilar gives up on the trip. She watches her mother poking at the plates of chips and salsa ready to go out--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mami, how old were you when my father--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was killed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. When he was killed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little older than Paloma is now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come you never got married again? Mercedes just glares at her--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There must have been somebody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was too busy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody's too busy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe now. It was different back then. I had this place, I was doing all the shopping, all the cooking. What do I need some chulo with grease under his nails to drink up the profit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't mean Fernando.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mami, the first time I brought him home, those were your exact words-- "some chulo with grease under his nails."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never said that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You made it pretty damn clear you thought he was nobody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I felt that you could do better for yourself--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Become a nun? You didn't want me going out with Anglos--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never said that. It was just that boy--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "That boy"--Mami, say his name for chrissakes! The employees are staring. Mercedes won't look at her daughter as she steps out of the kitchen, banging into Enrique on his way back in--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You people are stealing my money-- Entiende? Robandome? Mercedes is gone. The young girl, pulling plastic gloves on, looks to Pilar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Su madre? [Your mother?]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Si. The girl puts her hand on her heart in sympathy--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lo siento [My condolences.]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COUNTRY AND WESTERN BAR -- NIGHT A crowded room, C&W MUSIC plays on the box. Sam sits behind a bottle of beer as the bartender, CODY, in his early 50s philosophizes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I'm just as liberal as the next guy--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If the next guy's a redneck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --but I gotta say I think there's something to this cold climate business. I mean, you go to the beach- what do you do? Drink a few beers, wait for a fish to flop up on the sand. Can't build no civilization that way. You got a hard winter coming, though, you got to plan ahead, and that gives your cerebral cortex a workout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good deal you were born down here, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You joke about it, Sam, but we are in a state of crisis. The lines of demarcation has gotten fuzzy--to run a sucessfull civilization you got to have lines of demarcation between right and wrong, between this one and that one--your Daddy understood that. He was like the whatchacallit-- the referee for this damn menudo we got down here. He understood how most people don't want their sugar and salt in the same jar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mixed drinks bad as you mix metaphors, you be out of a job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take that pair over in the corner-- Sam swivels to look where Cody points--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Place like this, twenty years ago, Buddy woulda been, on them two--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- CORNER BOOTH Cliff and Priscilla talk across a table--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --warning. Not 'cause he had it in for the colored
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --but just as a kind of safety tip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I bet he would.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old Sam stood for somethin', you know? The day that man died they broke the goddamn mold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things are obviously more than professional between these two--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So where does that put us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well--I don't see what's changed. No - PDA's, no necking on the obstacle course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously, I think we should get married.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We been through this before--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should just do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I get a shot at a promotion somewhere--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could take it--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's up or out these days, Cliff. Say I get transferred to a different post--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd quit the Army for you, if it came to that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man's gonna retire in two years and he offer to quit. Big goddamn deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me-- They look up to see Sam standing over them--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheriff--hi--this is Sergeant--this is Priscilla Worth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pleased to meet you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheriff Deeds was in on our archeological find yesterday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It true they gonna build a shopping mall out there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If certain people have their way, it's going to be a new jail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn. Maybe we got in the wrong business. They closin' down military bases left and right, puttin' up jails like 7-11 stores.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do either of you have any idea when they stopped using that site as a rifle range?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stopped training infantry there in the late '50s. It was just a playground for the jackrabbits till they gave it to the county last year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know who it was they dug up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for sure yet. But I kind of wish they hadn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAFE -- NIGHT Enrique steps out of the darkened cafe, followed by Mercedes, who locks up. Mercedes steps over to an expensive-looking car--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Es muy lindo, su coche--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: En ingles Enrique. This is the United States. We speak English.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is very beautiful, your car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night, Enrique. She slides into the car--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buenas noches, Senora Cruz. Enrique walks in the opposite direction--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BIG O'S ROADHOUSE -- DAY -- CU DEL Del, in uniform, approaches the front door of Big O's, not open for business yet. We TIGHTEN as he stops to read a handlettered sign next to it: "BLACK SEMINOLE EXHIBIT REAR ENTRANCE." He steps in--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Late-50s R&B plays on the JUKEBOX. Otis stands behind the counter hooking the beer taps up. Del steps in and sits on a stool at the far end of the bar, tense, looking around the place. When Otis sees him, he stops dead. They lock eyes for a moment, then Otis turns to call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carolyn--knock that off for a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: an attractive woman maybe ten years younger than Otis, pulls the plug from the jukebox near where she's scrubbing bloodstains off the floor. She turns to look at the newcomer--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Del doesn't move to come closer--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Black Seminoles?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hobby of mine. Got some artifacts, couple pieces one of your men out at the base made. Free admission. Del nods toward where Carolyn is mopping--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That where he was shot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's where he fell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get much of that in here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a bar. People come together, drink, fall in love, fall out of love, air their grudges out--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deal drugs in the bathroom--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I thought it would help I'd put up a sign telling them not to. Right under the one about the employees washing their hands. Carolyn has come over by Otis, lugging the bucket and mop--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This here's Carolyn. Honey, this is my son, Delmore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to meet you, Ma'am. Carolyn nods, shoots a look to Otis--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be in back waiting for that delivery. They wail till she is gone to start again--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So tell me why I shouldn't make this place off-limits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is an official visit, then--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I assume a lot of your business is from our people. Otis pulls a tap back and it coughs before squirting beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your boys out there cooped up together, need somewhere they can let the steam out. If they're Black, there's not but one place in this town they feel welcome. Been that way since before you were born.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have an enlisted man's club at the post.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you're the Man out there now, aren't you? It's your call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I been hearing rumors about this new commander coming for a couple weeks now. Boys say they heard he's a real hard case. Spit-and-polish man. Full- bird colonel name of Payne, they say-- Bet you never figured you end up back here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Army hands you a command, you go wherever it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear things, too.  People call you the Mayor of Darktown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over the years, this is the one place that's always been there. I loan a little money out, settle some arguments. Got a cot in the back- people get afraid to go home they can spend the night. There's not enough of us to run anything in this town- the white people are mostly out on the lake now and the Mexicans hire each other. There's the Holiness Church and there's Big O's place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And people make their choice--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lot of 'em choose both. There's not like a borderline between the good people and the bad people--you're not either on one side or the other-- Del looks away, not wanting to believe this--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gonna meet that family of yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would you want to do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I'm your father. Del gives him a dark look and lets the statement hang between them. He gets up and heads for the door--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll get official notification when I make my decision. He is out the door--Otis pulls himself a beer as Carolyn steps back out--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So that's him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah--that's him. Got two, three thousand people under him out there, you count the civilians.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That must be a laugh a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SAN JACINTO STREET -- DAY Sam walks down the main street of town. A CROWD is gathering at the other end for the ceremony-- H.L. (O.S.) Sheriff! We WIDEN as H.L. and Jorge catch up to him. H.L. slaps Sam on the back-- H.L. Historic occasion, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seems like we have another one every week. H.L. Jorge and his Chamber of Commerce boys got to keep things hummin'--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're building up tourism, Sam--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People come here to catch bass and to get laid at the Boy's Town in Cuidad Leon--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ought to put up a banner-- "Frontera, Texas: Gateway to Cut- Rate Pussy"-- H.L. That kind of talk doesn't help, Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rather have that than the ten-foot- high catfish statue--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got Eddie Richter at the Sentinel to kill that story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Perdido thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He agreed it wasn't exactly news--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny's gonna be out for blood the next time. H.L. Which is why we need to talk to you about the new jail--just so we're all on the same page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't need a new jail. H.L. That's a matter of interpretation--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're already renting cells to the Feds for their overflow--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a mandate in the last election--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wouldn't happen to be your construction company gonna get the bid on building this thing, would it, H.L. And Jorge, you wouldn't be thinking about a couple dozen new jobs to dangle in front of the voters-- H.L. Dammit, Sam, the people are concerned about crime--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need a drug rehab program, we need a new elementary school--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There isn't money allocated for that. But a jail--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I'm not gonna campaign against your deal here, but if anybody asks me, I got to tell them the truth. We-- don't--need--a new jail. H.L. When we backed you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you backed me you needed somebody named Deeds to bump the other fella out of office.  Hey, folks-- Sam and the others smile as they reach the CROWD of townspeople, mostly small business owners and retired people. Photographers from the paper and a local TV news crew wait by a veiled Statue roped off in a little traffic island. Mercedes, dressed to kill, stands waiting next to Hollis with a huge pair of scissors in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly working the blades of the scissors, she looks coldly at Sam--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He nods to her as the crowd opens a path for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get this thing over with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MIKEY'S WORKSHOP -- MORNING We start on a two-foot-high statue of a cowboy made from old bullets and shell casings. We PAN past a few others, the poses lifted from Frederic Remington paintings, till we see Mikey, gluing together a work in progress, a Remington book propped open in front of him. Cliff sits at the worktable playing absently with the old bullets spilled out from MIKEY'S bag
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never thought I'd see the day a buddy of mine was dating a woman with three up and three down on her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's beyond what you'd call dating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You going to get married?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You met her family? They gonna be cool about you being a white guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Priscilla says they think any woman over 30 who isn't married must be a lesbian. She figures they'll be so relieved I'm a man--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Always heartwarming to see a prejudice defeated by a deeper prejudice.  But marriage, man--I did two tours in Southeast Asia and I was married for five years--I couldn't tell you which experience was worse. Cliff picks up a slug--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Mikey--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew she was Japanese going into it, but she didn't tell me the ninja assassin part--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mikey--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her parents acted like I was gonna blow my nose on their curtains--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mikey--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I stayed out past ten with the guys she'd go into her Madame Butterfly routine--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mikey look at this--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What--it's a bullet. I'm lousy with bullets here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a .45.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the stuff we picked up the other day, right? The rest of this is all .30 caliber--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were using M-1's, yeah--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's it doing on a rifle range?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holds the slug in front of his face--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We better call that Sheriff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SAN JACINTO STREET -- DAY Hollis is finishing his oration, having put the crowd in a good mood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometime in the early '70s a reporter from a national magazine was talking to the governor of our Lone Star state, and he asked him, "Governor, what's your ideal of what a real Texan ought to be?" Governor said, "That's easy, son- you just go down to Rio County and get a look at Sheriff Buddy Deeds." Applause--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watching the crowd--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We PAN with his gaze across smiling faces, till he comes to Danny and a couple of Chicano friends, looking grim. We RACK FOCUS beyond them to see Pilar, watching the ceremony from a few yards back--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. We've got one more person to hear from--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --and he's somebody who probably knew Buddy better than any of us, Sam--would you say a few words?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not thrilled to be called on. He steps forward reluctantly to APPLAUSE-- SAM You folks who remember my father knew him as Sheriff. But at home he was also judge, jury He looks to Hollis--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --and executioner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sam holds Hollis's eyes for a moment before continuing--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a real honor you're doing him today, and if Buddy was around I'm sure his hat size would be gettin' bigger every minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watching--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to come to this park to hide from him. Now that you're putting his name on it--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have to find someplace new to duck out. More LAUGHTER-- SAM I do appreciate it, and wherever he is, Buddy's puttin' the beer on ice for the bunch of you. Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam steps back and Mercedes steps forward with her scissors without looking at him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now my fellow Council member and one of Frontera's most respected businesswomen, Mrs. Mercedes Cruz, will do the honors for us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She freezes, smiling, till the still photographers have gotten their shots, then snips the cord to a pulley system that lets the cloth drop--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cloth drops to reveal a bas-relief in brass set in a block of smooth limestone.  A decent likeness of Buddy in uniform, his hand on the shoulder of a small Chicano-looking boy who stands beside him, eyes raised worshipfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from the gathering--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watching, a bit removed, as Mercedes shakes hands with Jorge and H.L. and Hollis for the cameras. He overhears a pair of BYSTANDERS who are checking out the statue--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It does look like old Buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Runnin that kid in for loiterin'-- The bystanders LAUGH--Sam steps away, intercepting Mercedes as she steps away--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to see you, Mrs. Cruz. Mercedes just looks at him, keeps going. His gaze brings him to Pilar, standing on the sidewalk, watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steps over from the dispersing crowd--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Field trip?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lunch hour. My next class isn't till nine-thirty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want to take a walk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIVERSIDE -- DAY Sam and PILAR walk together alongside the Rio--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother still doesn't like me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't name anybody she does like these days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see she built a place up here by the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A real palace. She rattles around alone in that thing--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's done well for herself--on her own and all--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So she tells me three times a week. She looks at him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you got through that pretty well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They cooked the whole thing up without asking me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People liked him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Most people did, yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember him watching me once. When I was little--before you and I-- She shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was on the playground with all the other kids, but I thought he was only looking at me. I was afraid he was going to arrest me--he had those eyes, you know--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weird what you remember. They walk in silence a moment--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your boy, there--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amado.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice-looking kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hates me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With Paloma, it's more like she pities and tolerates me- totally age- appropriate. But Amado--he's--he's never been book-smart. Had a hard time learning to read. Me being a teacher and caring about those things is like an embarrassment--like a betrayal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fernando did okay, and he dropped out--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fernando wasn't pissed off at everybody. He just wanted to fix their cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It might just be the age. I spent my first fifteen years trying to be just like Buddy and the next fifteen trying to give him a heart attack. She looks at him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why did you come back here, Sam?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got divorced, I wasn't gonna work for my father-in-law anymore. The fellas down here said they'd back me--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to be Sheriff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got to admit it's not what I thought it'd be. Back When Buddy had it-- hell, I'm just a jailer. Run a 60- room hotel with bars on the windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can happen so sudden, can't it? Being left out on your own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got your mother, your kids--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've got me. Different thing. They stop at a spot where you can climb down the bank--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember this? Pilar looks at the spot. She isn't ready to deal with whatever memory it brings back--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should get back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pilar--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks real bad if the teacher's late for class. It's really nice to talk with you, Sam. She waves and walks away, feeling awkward. Sam watches for a minute, then turns and steps down to the bank, He looks at the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little piece of tree bark is tossed onto the water and drifts away with the current. We TILT UP to see YOUNG PILAR tossing bark into the river as YOUNG SAM sits on the bank beside her. They are 14 and 15 years old--It is 1972-- YOUNG SAM You going to tell her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You going to tell him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't need to know all my business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gonna find out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So? What's he gonna do, arrest us? Young Pilar frowns, tosses more bark--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's supposed to be some big sin, even if you love each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You believe that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns to look at him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. We PAN with her gaze to see Sam, PRESENT DAY, sitting on the bank, lost in thought--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me neither.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ARMY POST -- DAY Athena walking between buildings, looking a bit out of it. Sergeant Worth cuts into her--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Private Johnson!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sergeant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Report to Dr. Innis at the clinic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm feeling okay--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm very happy to hear that, Private. Now you go put some pee-pee in a cup for Dr. Innis and I'll be feeling okay, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're testing me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and one hundred nineteen other fortunate individuals. Put it in gear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Sergeant. Sergeant Worth watches Athena go, suspicious--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SHERIFF'S OFFICE -- AFTERNOON Ray Hernandez and another DEPUTY guide Shadow back in from the courthouse in handcuffs--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent performance, my friend. The judge was very impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't need to cuff me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been talking so much trash today, you made us think you're a dangerous criminal. Be a good boy, now-- They guide him past Sam's desk--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the one who's a good boy. Man say "fetch" and you fetch--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just doing my job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: White man just using you to keep the Black man down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't Houston, my friend. We pretty much running things now. Our good day has come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You suckers haven't had a good day since the Alamo. Ray smiles, pushes him out--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andale, amigo, We HOLD on Sam at his desk, TIGHTENING as he holds the .45 slug from the sergeants in front of his eyes--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lupe? Get me the rangers up in Austin--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear old MEXICAN MUSIC. Ice cubes plunk into a glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R, MERCEDES Mercedes, exhausted from a day at the cafe, pours herself a Scotch and soda--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BACK PATIO -- NIGHT The back LIGHT is flicked on and Mercedes steps out with her drink in hand, the MUSIC audible from inside. She sinks into a recliner. We TIGHTEN as she closes her eyes. Something RUSTLES out In the dark. Mercedes opens her eyes. There is WHISPERING. Mercedes sits up and suddenly two MEN run past the edge of the patio toward the front of the house. Mercedes sighs--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otra vez los mojados--[Wetbacks again--] Mercedes searches to find a portable phone on the patio table, punches a number in--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Border Patrol?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SAM'S HOUSE -- NIGHT Sam, out of uniform, stands behind his little house chucking fallen pecans out into the dark, thinking, listening to the night sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Working something out in his head. He looks off into the dark and we PAN with his gaze--A MAN steps toward us, barely visible in the darkness. It is Charley Wade--We're in Sam's REVERIE, in 1957-- WADE Who is that? Come out here where I can see you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A GUNSHOT, and Wade falls to his knees--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sonofabitch-- Wade falls on his face. A FLASHLIGHT BEAM flicks ON and plays over his body. We PAN back along the be to see Buddy, holstering his Pistol. He hears something, swings the flashlight up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are back in 1995. Sam is blasted in the face with a FLASHLIGHT BEAM-- PATROLMAN (O.S.) Hold it right there! Brazos  arriba! Sam, squinting toward the light to see who it is, raises his hands over his head--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get that thing off 'im! He's one of ours--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zack? The FLASHLIGHT BEAM PANS AWAY and ZACK POLLARD, a Border Patrol agent, steps out of the dark to Sam--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Sam. Sorry 'bout that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had about a dozen wets come over just upriver. They ran into one of our posts--it was like a breakshot on a pool table, illegals runnin' every which way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't seen anybody come by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll get 'em-- (Looks around) So you livin' out here now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. It's quiet--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard about that deal for your father--You must be real proud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stories people tell, he was a real colorful fella--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zack! We got one!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well--back on the clock. You see any of our neighbors from the south, let 'em know I'm lookin' for 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Night-- Zack steps away.  Sam shakes the pecans still in his band, goes back to chucking them--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Older CHICANO COUPLES dance to Mexican Music playing from speakers set up in the apartment complex courtyard.  We TILT UP to see Enrique watching from his window--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: still blasting.  Enrique steps away from the window, and sits on the bed of his drab furnished apartment. He goes back to tying knots in a length of clothesline splicing it to another. On the bed beside him are new flashlights and the batteries, still in their packaging. He begins to coil the rope--it is hundreds of feet long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FRONT PORCH, PILAR'S HOUSE -- NIGHT Pilar sits on her front Porch, listening to the MUSIC in the distance. A woman singing a MEXICAN LOVE BALLAD. After a while we hear Paloma open the screen door behind her--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna stay out here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a while. A silence. They listen to the RECORD-- PALOMA (O.S.) What's she singing about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SHERIFF'S OFFICE -- EARLY MORNING Sam has been up since dawn, searching through piles of old department records. Papers cover his desk and the chairs he's dragged over next to it. He reads out loud himself from a report in front of him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First bullet entered beneath the left eye, severing the optical nerve and exiting from top rear of skull causing tissue damage
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Sam reads, we see quick pops of various records-- Certificates of death. An old Sheriff's Department payroll. An autopsy report. Eviction notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --and severe cerebral hemorrhaging. Second bullet entered left cheek driving fragment of upper and lower molars into base of skull. Third bullet-- Real estate transfers. A map of the Proposed Lake Pescadero. Another autopsy report. A FAX COPY of the forensics dental report on Charley Wade. Another autopsy report--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Intent as he pores over the paperwork--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We TILT DOWN to read various notes Sam has written--Reynaldo Garcia killed by Shf Wade--3/49 Hollis Kinney hired by Shf Dep.--9/51 Lucas Johnson k. by Shf Wade--7/53 Horace Gaines k. by Shf Wade--1/54 Santiago Huerta k. by Shf Wade--4/54 Rifle range closed--9/56 Eladio Cruz k. by Shf Wade--12/56 Buddy Deeds hired by Shf Dep.--2/57 Shf Wade disappears--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: $10,000 cnty funds missing Buddy Deeds new Shf We come to Sam's hand, writing, when it clears we can read the last entry-- Mercedes Cruz hired as cook, Rio Co. jail--4/57 ?????
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trying to put it all together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a skinny, older man in trustee's coveralls, wanders in, emptying the trash baskets in the front office--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, Sheriff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Pete. How's it going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time marches on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much you got left?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stop growing that loco weed at your place, you'd see a lot more daylight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was for personal consumption.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to smoke an acre and a half of marijuana?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a bad stomach. It helps me digest. Pete dumps out the basket by Sam--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father never bothered me about it. Leastways not till the drug people got on his back in the late '60s.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought he busted you a couple times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Different charge. I had a still. Made my own mescal. Sam looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how I ruined my stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm surprised he bothered with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was afraid I was going to poison somebody. Your father tried to do good for people--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I've heard--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And your mother was a saint. That summer I built the patio at your house? She made me lunch every day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you were working there--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It could have just been a box lunch from the jail. Sam looks up again, troubled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You built our patio while you  were on the county?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out in the fresh air, nice gringo lady making you pies--who's gonna sit back in a little jail cell all day? Sheriff Buddy, man. Como el no hay dos. And after that cabron Charley Wade--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've heard Wade was a bit tough on the Mexicans--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He murdered Eladio Cruz. That tough enough for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murdered him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chucho Montoya saw it with his own eyes. Shot him in cold blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SAN JACINTO STREET -- MORNING Ray Hernandez, heading in to work, comes upon Sam getting into his car--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're out early.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haven't seen much of you at the jail lately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I been working on a few things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going over to the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Republicans?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No--to Mexico. I've got to talk to somebody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They got telephones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta be in person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. An awkward silence. Sam sits into the driver's seal and Ray leans down to talk--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam? I--the Committee--you know Jorge and H.L. and all--they asked me--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They want you to stand for Sheriff next election.
direction.name: direction
