direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd do a good job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know if I'll still want it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want to be going around your back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I appreciate you telling me. Sam looks at his Chief Deputy--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think we need a new jail?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's a complicated issue-- Sam smiles, turns the engine on--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Ray, you'd be a hell of a Sheriff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCHOOL -- MORNING Pilar sits with Amado on the football field bleachers before school starts--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only going to have you for two more years. If you decide not to go on to college--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't take any more school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --you're going to be on your own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I'm worried about you. I don't want you to end up in jail like your friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're not going to jail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't try to con me, Amado. You knew how they got all those things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just some rich Anglo out on the lake. Don't even live here all year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That makes it okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stole our land--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Save your breath. That line doesn't cut it with me. A silence. Amado sulks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you think you're going to make a living?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can fix cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can fix old cars. Mr. Washburn told me that the cars they're making now are all computerized--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I can't learn that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you can learn whatever you want to. I just don't see you doing it. If you want to settle for--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not settling for anything. I like cars, it's just not a move up the ladder to you, so you think it's a waste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That isn't true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, come on--you and Grandma think anybody who works with their hands is a peasant. When Dad--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you grew up to he anywhere near as good a man as your father was, I would be happy! I would be thrilled. They look, at each other for a long moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my life. If I want to fuck it up, that's my business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said pretty much the same thing to my mother when I was your age.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what did she do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two years at hard labor, Our Lady of Perpetual Help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Catholic school, nasty. Pilar is nearly in tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, I think you're smart and you're good and I love you. So don't act like an idiot, all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BORDER CROSSING -- DAY We see Sam's car roll through the "express lane" as other cars in both directions stop by the inspection booths. Sam drives across the bridge over the Rio--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STREETS -- CIUDAD LEON -- VARIOUS SHOTS Sam drives slowly through the sprawling, more populous town on the other side.  Lots of the streets are unpaved.  We PAN with the car till we HOLD on ANSELMA, a country girl of 15, aimlessly walking the streets--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We watch a KID about Amado's age pulling a tire off its rim to put a patch on it--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over here we don't throw everything away like you gringos do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in his mid-50s, stands by Sam drinking a Coke as they watch the kid work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Recycling, right? We invented that. The government doesn't have to tell people to do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You own this place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This place, the one across the street, four other ones around Ciudad Leon-- soy el Rey de las Llantas. King of the Tires. Lots of your people rollin' back over that bridge on my rubber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lived in the States for a while?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifteen years in El Paso.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Made some money, came back here--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ever know a fella named Eladio Cruz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles, draws a line in the dirt with his heel--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You the sheriff of Rio County, right? Un jefe muy respetado. Step over this line. Sam obliges--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ay, que milagro! You're not the Sheriff of nothing anymore- just some tejano with a lot of questions I don't have to answer. Sam smiles, plays with the line with his toe--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bird flying south-you think he sees that line? Rattlesnake, javelina-- whatever you got--halfway across that line they don't start thinking different. So why should a man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your government always been pretty happy to have that line. The question's just been where to draw it
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My government can go fuck itself, and so can yours. I'm talking about people here--men. Mi amigo Eladio Cruz is giving some friends of his a lift in his camion one day-- We PAN from CHUCHO to the FLAT TIRE on a battered old pickup truck--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --but because he's on one side of this invisible line and not the other, they got to hide in the back like criminals-- Eladio CRUZ, young and good-looking, squats into the shot to examine the tire, jack in hand. It Is 1956-- CHUCHO (V.O.) And because over there he's just another Mex bracero, any man with a badge is his jefe--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes from the truck RADIO. YOUNG CHUCHO steps past Eladio--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donde vas, Chucho, Tienes que quedar escondido! [Shit, CHUCHO you got to stay hidden!]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Voy a romper las rinones si no hago pipi--[I'm gonna bust my kidneys if I don't pee--] We TRACK back with Young CHUCHO to see we are at the side of a dirt road on the scrubby flatland near the border. Eladio's battered pickup truck has wood-slat sides and a canvas top. Eladio begins to undo the nuts on the flat tire as Young CHUCHO climbs down into a dry creek bed to relieve himself--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Los demas son tan espantados que prefieran mojar sus pantalones. [The other guys are so scared they'd rather wet their pants.]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tightens as he sees something, ducks down--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mira, Eladio [Look!] We PAN to see the Sheriff's car approaching in a cloud of DUST-- ELADIO (Calling from where he lies changing the tire) Muchachos! Escondases! [Boys! Hide yourselves!]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight illegal WORKERS hear this and lie down, pulling a canvas tarp over themselves. We hear the CAR STOP behind them--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He makes the sign of the cross as he presses his back against the dirt of the arroyo--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheriff Wade and Deputy Hollis get out of their car and start toward Eladio--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stands, takes a deep breath--Wade steps up to him with his hard-eyed smile--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hola, amgio. Problemas de llanta? [Hey, friend. Tire problems?]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No hay de que. Tengo otra. [No problem, I've got another.]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's in the back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Young Hollis strolls around the truck as if he's considering buying it.  He reaches in and flicks the RADIO OFF-- ELADIO Not much, jefe. Some watermelons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard somebody been haulin' wets on this road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't seen anybody doing that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This same person been bragging all over the county how he don't have to cut that big gringo Sheriff in on it-- he can run his own operation 'thout any help. Como se llama, amigo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eladio Cruz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know this road got a bad reputation, Eladio--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Young CHUCHO pecks over the edge to see what's happening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reputation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bandidos, Injuns--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R -- MEN Hollis wanders over to stand by Wade--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's many an unfortunate soul been ambushed out on this stretch. Hope you're carrying some protection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Protection?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You carryin' a firearm, son?  Don't lie to me now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Si--tengo escopeto--just a shotgun--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a shotgun, huh? Better let me take a look at that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: opens the truck door and digs under the seat. Wade winks to Hollis, then turns and BLAM! shoots ELADIO through the head. Hollis jumps back startled and horrified--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no--oh Jesus--oh my Lord--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little greaser sonofabitch been running a goddarn bus service. Think he can make a fool out of Charley Wade! Get them wets outta the back, Hollis, see what we've got--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Squatting in a ball to make himself as small as possible, eyes covered with his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You killed him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a talent for statin' the obvious, son Muchachos! Venga afuera!Brazos arribas! [Come on out! Hands up!] Young CHUCHO hears FOOTSTEPS approaching. We PAN as he looks-- a man's BOOTS appear at the top of the arroyo. We TILT UP to see a Sheriff, BACKLIT, then CRANE to see it is Sam, back in the PRESENT looking over the site, troubled. His car sits on the empty road behind him. He frowns, turns to go--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody has spray-painted "PERDIDO!" over the plaque of Buddy and the little boy--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooligans--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R Hollis and a couple of MEN from the Public Work Department look at the damage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It happens again, we build a fence around it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAFE -- DAY Enrique steels himself, trying to cover his nerves. We CROSS with him to a booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Podemos ganar muchas batallas pero la guerra ya es perdido--[We can win a lot of battles but the war's already been lost--] Zack and another BORDER PATROLMAN look up at him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eyes glued to his notepad--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wan' something to drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Georgia O'Keefe-looking cattle skull sits on a pedestal against the Western sky--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The longhorns go for ten times the price-- We WIDEN as the skull is lifted by WESLEY BIRDSONG, a Native American man in his 70s who wears extremely thick glasses. Sam tags along as the old man rearranges the display of Texas curios laid out in front of his trailer. Empty scrubland surrounds them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --but longhorns are hard to come by these days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sell much out here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How am I gonna sell things if nobody comes by? This stretch of road runs between Nowheres and Nothin' Much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell of a spot to put a business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you don't see much competition, do you? He winks at Sam, picks up a wooden radio carved to resemble the Alamo--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These things used to sell like hotcakes. Now, if it can't play those discs, they won't look at it. He puts the radio on, looks out at the emptiness around--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like it here. Once I tried going onto that reservation to live. Couldn't take the politics. Damn Indian'll drive you crazy with that, Now your father--this wasn't what he had in mind at all. He come out of Korea, he had this Chevy with too much engine in it. He'd come roarin' up and down this road all hours of the day and night,looking for somebody to race. He lifts a jar with a leathery brown thing in it--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffalo chips. Fella in Santa Fe told me he sells these as fast as the buffalo can squeeze 'em out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So when did Buddy leave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For Frontera? Hell, I can't remember dates no more. I do recall it was after an affair of the heart had gone sour on him. He almost took some poor fella's head off at the Legion in Arroyo Grande, and figured it was time to move on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think he killed anybody in Korea?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't hand those medals out for hidin'in your foxhole. Would you buy this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me neither. He searches for something among the curios--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he hadn't found that Deputy job, I believe Buddy might've gone down the other path, got into some serious trouble. Settled him right down. That and your mother. 'Course he had that other one later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another woman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother wasn't one to get chased off her patch. Half the damn county knew and nobody thought the worse of her for seein' it through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know who it was?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The other one? Hell, at my age, every time you learn a new name you got to forget an old one. Your head's all crowded up--here it is-- Wesley stretches out a four-foot rattlesnake skin, rattles still attached--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This big fella was sleepin' in a crate at Cisco's junkyard right when I looked to see what was in it. Jumped up at my face--scared me so bad I killed him without thinkin'. He shakes the rattles at Sam--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta be careful where you're pokin'-- who knows what you'll find.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: ROADSIDE STAND -- DAY -- CU CATTLE SKULL A

direction.raw_text: talks with Molly as they near the administration office--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think you can take it personally--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to see them spend a day pulling 14-year-olds off of each other--I should get combat pay--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have new respect for some of my kids, meeting the parents they've been dealt-- Molly keeps going as Pilar ducks into the office--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you, Molly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: crosses past the principal's secretary, MARISOL-- MARISOL Steve called for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve. Board of Education Steve who likes you? He goes for us hot-blooded Mexican girls, I can tell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spanish, please. My mother would have a heart attack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother's family is Spanish?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, they go back to Cortez. When he rode by, they were squatting in a hut cooking hamsters for dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got to be interested in somebody. All you do is work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All my mother does is work. That's how you get to be Spanish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout the Sheriff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Sheriff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old-high-school-heartthrob Sheriff. I thought you were crazy about each other. He's available, you're available--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm unmarried. I'm not available.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told me one time it was true love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes the pile of mimeos and mail from her slot and turns to go--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody stays in love for twenty-three years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVE-IN MOVIE -- NIGHT It is 1972. An early-'70s cheezy action picture (Filipino women-in-chains or biker flick is playing. We TILT DOWN to a man's BOOTS crunching across the gravel of the parking area. Now and then, the man turns a FLASHLIGHT BEAM on a license plate. The cars are all pre-'72, lots of pickups, and the patrons are almost all TEENAGERS. Some have turned their pickups around to sit on the tailgate and watch, while others have set lawn furniture out to sit on. We TILT UP slightly to see the glint of a Rio County Sheriff's badge pinned on the man's shirt. He meets a DEPUTY coming in the other direction. Both train their FLASHLIGHTS on the license of the car we see in the b.g. between them.  We TILT and RACK to see that nobody is visible through the window--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. We FOLLOW Buddy up to the driver's side of the car as the Deputy goes to the passenger side. We PAN with Buddy's hand down to the door handle--he grabs it, flings it open--the overhead LIGHT flicks ON and there lie YOUNG SAM and PILAR, teenagers, half their clothes off and just about to close the deal. PILAR SCREAMS and the Deputy throws the door open by their heads--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit! Buddy grabs Sam's ankles and yanks him out of the car onto the ground as the Deputy awkwardly pulls PILAR, out the other side--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you doing? You fucking asshole!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How old is that girl? Goddammit, where's your goddam sense?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me go!  Pendejo!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on now, Missy, get your clothes in order-- Sam is trying to kick and punch at his father, pausing in between to pull his pants up. People are BOOING and HONKING their HORNS all around--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got no fuckin' right! You stay out of my fuckin' life!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme the keys--gimme the goddamn car keys, son--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I s'posed to do with her, Buddy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You drive her home and tell her mother where we found her--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam! The kids are dragged forward into the HEADLIGHTS that are being turned on to see what the ruckus is. Both are crying, struggling--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You leave her the fuck alone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just shut that filthy mouth, son. I'll deal with you when we get home--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, don't tell my mother! She's gonna kill me! They step closer into the glaring HEADLIGHTS which WHITE OUT the scene, then FADE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RUINED DRIVE-IN -- DUSK It is DUSK, PRESENT DAY. Our eyes readjust to see Sam, standing by his car in the lot of the long-abandoned drive- in. The ruined screen rises in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remembering. MUSIC BEGINS as he gets back into the car, pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the car cruises out past the old marquee, a few letters still jumbled on it, several bullet holes around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Sam drives, thinking--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROADS -- VARIOUS SHOTS -- DUSK/NIGHT MUSIC CONTINUES as the car crosses the scrubland back toward town. DUSK turns to NIGHT-- EXT. PILAR'S HOUSE -- NIGHT MUSIC CONTINUES as Sam cruises past Pilar's house. The car is not in the driveway: Paloma hangs out with a couple FRIENDS under the porch light, laughing--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Sam's car pulls into the high school lot. He looks up toward the school--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WINDOW, PILAR, -- SAM'S POV MUSIC CONTINUES. We can see PILAR, through the lighted window of her classroom, preparing something on the blackboard--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Sam leans back to wait--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: digs in her bag for her car keys as she makes her way across the lot. She sees something, slows, reacting, then brings us to Sam in his car. He has parked head-to-foot next to hers. They look at each other for a long moment
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Follow me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MAIN STREET -- NIGHT Nothing stirring. Pilar's car appears, closely followed by Sam's. The cafe has closed for the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAFE -- NIGHT Sam and Pilar sit on chairs next to each other, facing the window, talking softly. The STREETLIGHT shining through the letters in the front window makes patterns on their faces
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We thought we were something, didn't we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I look at my kids in school--tenth, eleventh graders. That's who we were. Children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean what did we know about anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Pilar looks at him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When Nando died--it was so sudden--I was kind of in shock for awhile. Then I woke up and there was the whole rest of my life and I didn't have any idea what to do with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know the other day, you asked why I came back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came back 'cause you were here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods. She gets up and we FOLLOW her across the dark room to the jukebox. She looks at the selections--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother hasn't changed the songs since I was 10. She puts in a quarter, punches some numbers. A Mexican BALLAD comes on. She crosses back to Sam, holds her hand out. He stands to greet her. They slow-dance in the empty cafe--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam and Pilar finish making love. They lie beside each other, shaking a little--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come it feels the same?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. It just feels good. Always did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what are we gonna do about this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More, I hope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles, looks around the room--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long have you lived here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing on the walls. No pictures--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't have kids. Other pictures--I don't know--it's nothing I want to look back on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like your story is over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've felt that way, yeah. Sbe puts her head on his cbest--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It isn't. Not by a long shot. He holds her and they lie silently for a moment--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pilar--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was your father's name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eladio. Eladio. Cruz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PILAR'S HOUSE -- MORNING Paloma sits on the top step of the porch, reading teen magazines. PILAR steps out behind her, dressed casually, and squints at the day--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She finally got in--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Saturday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got in late last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I had uhm--school business. Paloma gives her a look, then holds a fashion page up for her to see--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I get this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody really wears that stuff, Paloma.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could name five girls at school who have one just like it--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough with the clothes--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just 'cause you went to Catholic school and wore a uniform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only went for my last two years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my mother wanted to keep me away from away from boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steps out into the sun--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did it work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAFE -- MORNING Hollis is sitting alone in a booth, working on some heuvos rancheros.  Sam slides in across from him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, Hollis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam! Quite a do the other day. It meant a lot to folks that you said something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You thought any more about our murder?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have a murder?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charley Wade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I could tell you I remembered something new, but I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got an idea what happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think somewhere between Roderick Bledsoe's club and his house, Wade ran into Buddy Deeds. I think Buddy put a bullet in him, waited for him to die, threw him in the trunk of the Sheriff's car and drove him out by the Army post, I think he buried him under four feet of sand and never looked back. Hollis sits back to look Sam in the eye--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lived in the man's house what-- seventeen, eighteen years? And you didn't get to know him any better than that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got to go see somebody in San Antonio today. Your memory gets any better, I'll be back tonight. Sam stands and walks away. We HOLD on Hollis, his appetite gone--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BIG O'S -- MORNING Chet steps around to the side entrance--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We start on a statue of a BUFFALO SOLDIER made from spent bullets and shell casings, then PAN to another, then WIDEN to see Chet as he pokes his head in, the BELL of the door ringing.  He steps in cautiously, looking around the room. On the walls there are photo-blowups, some artifacts, handlettered information on cardboard. Chet stops to look up at a picture of a barechested Black man with a couple of feathers stuck in his headband
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's John Horse. Chet turns to see Otis standing back by, the door from the bar--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spanish in Florida called him Juan Caballo. John Horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He a Black man or an Indian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both. Otis crosses to the poker table, begins to clean up--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was part of the Seminole Nation, got pushed down into the Everglades in pioneer days. African people who run off from the slaveholders hooked up with them, married up, had children. When the Spanish give up Florida, the U.S.Army come down to move all them Indian peoples off to Oklahoma--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Trail of Tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They teaching that now?  Good. Only a couple of 'em held out--this man, John Horse, and his friend Wild Cat, and a fella name of Osceola. Army put all of them in prison and Osceola died, but them other two escaped and put together a fighting band and held out another ten, fifteen years. Beat Zach Taylor and a thousand troops at Lake Okeechobee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So they stayed in Florida?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They got tired of fighting, went to the Indian Territories for a while. But the slave-raiders were on 'em even there, and one night they packed up and nearly the whole band rode down to Mexico. Crossed at Eagle Pass. They move on to some photos of very African-looking people dressed in beautiful Seminole clothing--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Men worked for Santa Anna down there, waited out the Civil War. The land wasn't much to feed people on, so in 1870 they come north and put up at Fort Duncan and the men joined up what was called the Seminole Negro Indian Scouts. Best trackers either side of the border. Bandits, rustlers, Texas rednecks, Kiowa, Comanche--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They fought against the Indians?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same as they done in Mexico.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they were Indians themselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were in the Army. Like your father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know who I am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a pretty good guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That guy who got shot--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't go telling your father you were here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding? And face a court- martial?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a pretty tough old man, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sports if I don't keep a B average, no TV on school nights, no PDA's--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Public Display of Affection. Every time he moves up a rank, it's like he's got to tighten the screws a little more--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, just 'cause he didn't--you know--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't have a father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's still pissed off about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you're his age you'll still be pissed off about him. Chet nods, looks around--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how come you got into all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are our people. There were Paynes in Florida, Oklahoma, Piedras Negras--couple of 'em won the whatsit-- Congressional Medal Of Honor--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I'm part-Indian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By blood you are. But blood only means what you let it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father says the day you're  born you start from scratch, no breaks and no excuses, and you got to pull yourself up on your own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he's living proof of that, son. Living proof.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: BLACK SEMINOLE EXHIBIT -- DAY -- CU STATUE

direction.raw_text: . DEL'S OFFICE -- DAY Athena stands at attention as Del sits at his desk, reviewing her record. He lets her stand for a long time before speaking--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Private Johnson, are you unhappy in the Army?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then how would you explain the fact that out of one hundred twenty people we tested, you're the only one who came up positive for drugs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you were given the opportunity to enlist, a kind of contract was agreed upon. I think the Army has honored its part of that agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you believe in what we're doing here, Private Johnson?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: can do the job, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't sound too enthusiastic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What exactly do you think your job is, Private?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Follow orders. Do whatever they say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's "they"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The--the officers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's the job? Nothing about serving your country? Athena is confused, hesitates to speak--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These aren't trick questions, Private. You'll be given an Article 15 and be going into the ADCAP Program one way or the other. What happens after that is up to you. I'm just trying to understand how somebody like you thinks. Silence--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really want to know, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's their country. This is one of the best deals they offer. Del knows he asked for it, but doesn't like the answer--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you think I got to be a colonel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Work hard, be good at your job. Sir. Do whatever they tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do whatever they tell you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, follow orders, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With your attitude, Private, I'm surprised you want to stay in the service.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's a job?

direction.raw_text: . He waves his pistol, indicating something behind Otis--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We shoot past Wade at the counter as Otis turns and reaches for a cigar box on the shelf behind--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lying open, an old pistol inside of it. Young Otis reaches--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Frowning as he senses something wrong--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Wade levels his gun at Young Otis's back, then turns to wink at Hollis like he did before he shot Eladio--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Finger closing around the trigger of the .45--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mouth open in horror--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Eyes burning as he aims--
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CALLS OUT-- YOUNG OTIS MUSIC CONTINUES

direction.raw_text: . Stepping in the door, seeing, CALLS OUT-- YOUNG OTIS MUSIC CONTINUES. Turning to see Buddy--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! THWAP! A bullet plows through his neck, knocking him back against the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . His gun falls from his hand--
direction.name: direction

result.heading: MUSIC CONTINUES-- BAR COUNTER MUSIC CONTINUES

direction.raw_text: Horrified, splattered with the Sheriff's blood. MUSIC CONTINUES-- BAR COUNTER MUSIC CONTINUES. Twenty-dollar bills have spilled out of the envelope and are soaking up blood--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm and hard-eyed. MUSIC CONTINUES. As he steps forward, we see his pistol is still in its holster. He reaches out and takes the .45 from Young Hollis's shaking hand, looks him in the eye till Hollis looks back, then looks toward Young Otis-- We PAN with his gaze to a CLOSE-UP of Otis, back in the PRESENT. The MUSIC FADES-- OTIS Sheriff Charley had some real big friends in politics then, and if the truth come out it wasn't going to go easy on Hollis. (He shrugs) I don't know why I trusted Buddy with it--don't know why he trusted me. The first time I ever talked with him was right there, and then with a dead white man leakin' blood on the floor between us. He could charm the scales off a rattler, Buddy Deeds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R This isn't what Sam was expecting. Hollis watches his face--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three of us cleaned up and took him to the post and put him under. Can't say I was much help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the ten thousand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Widow's benefits. He figured it would make the disappearance look better, and that Mexican gal was just scrapin' by after Charley killed her man. They didn't get hooked up till late--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time went on, people liked the story that we told better than anything the truth might have been. Sam swivels around on his seat to took at the spot where Charley fell. He has a lot of information to deal with--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the call, Sam? Sam rolls it over in his mind before answering--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't think the Rangers are likely to find out any more than they already have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Word gets out who that body was, people are gonna think Buddy done it. Sam gets up--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy's a goddamn legend. He can handle it. He heads for the door--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Night, fellas. Hollis and Otis watch him go--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVE-IN, WIDE SHOT -- MORNING We see Sam sitting on the hood of his car parked in the deserted drive-in lot, staring up at the ruined screen. Pilar's car rolls in, parks beside him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R Pilar gets out, kisses Sam, sits by him on the hood--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When's the picture start? Sam looks at her for a moment--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna tell your mother we been seeing each other?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll figure it out sooner or later. I don't have to ask permission anymore, if that's what you mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have any idea when your father died? Eladio?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couple months before I was born--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try a year and a half. He bands her an old snapshot. PILAR looks at it--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy and Young Mercedes on the lake. Buddy with his shirt off on one end of a sailboat, Mercedes in a bathing suit, both smiling for the camera--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pilar hands the photo back to him, tries to be calm--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never seen my mother in a bathing suit before.  Didn't know she owned one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy bought the cafe for her with money he took from the county. Pilar looks away, struggling not to cry--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They can't pull this on me. It isn't fair--I don't believe this--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He paid the hospital bill when you were born. Your mom always calls you "our beautiful daughter" in the letters she wrote to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the first time I saw you at school--all those years we were married to other people I always felt like we were connected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember thinking you were the one part of my life Buddy didn't have a piece of-- A silence, both of them wondering what the next move should be--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So that's it? You're not going to want to be with me anymore? Sam knows what he feels but doesn't have the words--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not having any more children. After Amado, I had some complications-- I can't get pregnant again, if that's what the rule is about--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I met you for the first time today, I'd still want to be with you. It is what Pilar needed to hear--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We start from scratch--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything that went before, all that stuff, that history--the hell with it, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes Sam's hand, kisses him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget the Alamo.
direction.name: direction
